alert.note: Alert for Noble (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:19AM EST until further notice by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Indiana... North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The north end of Lakeview Drive is covered by water. Several houses have water to their foundations on Steinberger Lake Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 6.3 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Friday was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
